lead_paragraph: The fear is frequently expressed that in waging total war the democracies may lose the very thing for which they are fighting. Even though political democracy survives the war, it is feared that the strains of post-war reconstruction may prove too much for it; that a disillusioned and pessimistic people will turn despairingly to the totalitarian principle for the sake of stronger leadership and greater security.
